newsitem.title: ESTONIA: VIISNURK Q1 PROFIT 1.4 MILLION KROONS.
newsitem.headline: VIISNURK Q1 PROFIT 1.4 MILLION KROONS.

text.p: Viisnurk, one of the world's main cross-country ski firms, said on Thursday its first quarter profit was 1.4 million kroons on sales of 32.6 million kroons.
Viisnurk plans a 11.7 million kroon share issue beginning on May 12 and later a listing on the Tallinn stock exchange.
"The first and second quarters are always poor due to the seasonal nature of the ski industry," Andrus Aljas, Viisnurk's finance director, told Reuters.
Aljas said the company made a loss in the first quarter of 1996 of 1.3 million kroons.
"The third and fourth quarters are what make a profit for the company," he added.
In 1996 the company made a net profit of 8.1 million kroons and turned over 154 million kroons.
